document.title: EiffelVision Interface Content
document.paragraph:
EiffelVision 2 is a platform independent Graphical User Interface (GUI) library that allows easy, simultaneous development of Windowed applications for both Windows & Unix based platforms. Heavily relying on ISE's premier EiffelBase library, EiffelVision 2 has been designed primarily with ease of use in mind. By reusing EiffelBase structures, existing, as well as new Eiffel users will find EiffelVision to be surprising intuitive and easy to use. In no time, users will be producing good-looking Windowed application skeletons, of which will run on a multitude of platforms with no manipulation of code. The EiffelVision 2 library includes the following interface clusters:
A
00_kernel/index.xml Kernel cluster that includes classes that are key to a Vision2 application. The main class being
../reference/interface/kernel/ev_application_chart.xml EV_APPLICATION which is the main entry point of all Vision2 applications.
A
10_widgets/index.xml Widgets cluster containing classes that used to create Vision2 widgets. Widgets are the visible objects that the user sees and interacts with on the desktop, examples of widgets are windows, buttons and labels.
An
20_items/index.xml Items cluster includes the classes needed to create items, items can be thought of as widgets that are contained within only a certain type of widget, such as an
../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/ev_list_chart.xml EV_LIST that may only contain objects of type
../reference/interface/items/ev_list_item_chart.xml EV_LIST_ITEM . Items provide an abstract way of dealing with an item widget's internal data structures and provide in many cases the same functionality that a widget does.
An
30_events/index.xml Events cluster containing classes that allow for user initiated events, such as the clicking of a button to be dealt with via the use of a linked list of agents (
../reference/interface/events/ev_action_sequence_chart.xml EV_ACTION_SEQUENCE ). Agents can be thought of as an object that encapsulates a certain procedure. When a user clicks a button on the screen, the corresponding
../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/ev_button_chart.xml EV_BUTTON object has its associating pointer_button_press_actions fired and this in turn, fires all of the agents held within, thus calling all of the procedures represented by the agents. Every widget and item has a certain number of
../../base/reference/event/action_sequence_chart.xml ACTION_SEQUENCE objects that are linked with a certain type of event.
A
40_properties/index.xml Properties cluster contains classes that allow for the customization of Vision 2 widgets and items. Classes such as
../reference/interface/properties/ev_colorizable_chart.xml EV_COLORIZABLE and
../reference/interface/properties/ev_fontable_chart.xml EV_FONTABLE contain routines that allow for color and fonts to be altered for a widget or item respectively.
A
50_support/index.xml Support cluster includes classes that provide more professional touches to an application, whether these are keyboard shortcuts (
../reference/interface/support/ev_accelerator_list_chart.xml EV_ACCELERATOR_LIST ) or graphical output (
../reference/interface/support/ev_graphical_format_chart.xml EV_GRAPHICAL_FORMAT ) for drawable widgets such as
/libraries/vision2/reference/interface/widgets/primitives/ev_pixmap_chart.xml EV_PIXMAP .
A
60_figures/index.xml Figures cluster that allows for the projection of two-dimensional shapes (figures) on to an
../reference/interface/properties/ev_drawable_chart.xml EV_DRAWABLE or printer via the use of an
../reference/interface/figures/ev_projector_chart.xml EV_PROJECTOR .
